intro: Acetosella violacea var. albida, commonly known as the white sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves that are typically pale green to white in color, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually pink or white, clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
